.

Al Hudayda (often spelt Al Hodeidah) is a large Yemeni town on the Red Sea coast.  Tourism is not a big industry, so there are relatively few facilities for visitors.
There are regular flights from Sana'a, which take about half an hour.  The road from Sana'a is not in good condition.

There are very few good hotels in the town.  The only real exception is the Hodeidah Land Resort.  There are a number of small hotels in the city centre, but they are poor by any international standards.

value: content=Pleasant hotel just outside the main town.  Has a number of villas arranged in a circle, some of which have their own private pools.  Wireless internet is available.
